questions.question: After starting the simulation, why are items processed in descending order of value-to-weight ratio?

answers.a: To minimize the number of items selected
answers.b: To ensure maximum value is obtained per unit weight

explanations.a: The objective is not to minimize item count but to maximize value.
explanations.b: Selecting items with higher value-to-weight ratio first ensures optimal value gain.
explanations.c: Execution time is not the primary reason for sorting.
explanations.d: Items are reordered based on ratio, not input order.

questions.question: What does the knapsack fill indicator represent during the simulation?

answers.c: Current weight filled relative to maximum capacity

explanations.a: Value is shown separately in the Results panel.
explanations.b: The fill indicator is based on weight, not item count.
explanations.c: The indicator visualizes how much of the knapsack capacity is filled by weight.
explanations.d: Execution time is not visualized using the fill bar.

questions.question: In Manual Mode, what happens when the selected item cannot fully fit into the remaining knapsack capacity?

answers.c: A fraction of the item is added to fill the remaining capacity
answers.d: The item is added fully, exceeding capacity

explanations.a: Fractional Knapsack does not skip valuable items unnecessarily.
explanations.b: The simulation continues until capacity is filled.
explanations.c: A fractional part is taken to exactly utilize the remaining capacity.
explanations.d: The algorithm never exceeds knapsack capacity.

questions.question: Why does the simulation stop automatically once the knapsack reaches full capacity?

answers.b: Further addition would violate the capacity constraint
answers.c: The maximum value has already been displayed

explanations.a: Items may still exist but cannot be added.
explanations.b: Once capacity is full, adding more weight is not allowed.
explanations.c: Displaying value is not the stopping condition.
explanations.d: Animation speed does not affect termination.

questions.question: In the Results table, what does a value like "66.7%" taken for an item indicate?

answers.c: Only a fraction of the item was added to the knapsack
answers.d: The item had the highest ratio

explanations.a: Skipped items show no percentage taken.
explanations.c: A percentage less than 100% indicates fractional inclusion.
explanations.d: Ratio is shown separately, not as a percentage taken.

questions.question: During Auto Play mode, which component explains the decision taken at each step of the algorithm?

explanations.a: The Items Panel shows sorted items, not decisions.
explanations.b: The Knapsack Panel shows filling visualization only.
explanations.c: The Execution Log describes each decision taken by the algorithm.
explanations.d: Input panel is only for user input.

questions.question: If two items have the same value-to-weight ratio, how does the simulation handle their selection?

answers.c: Any order can be chosen without affecting optimality
answers.d: The heavier item is always selected first

explanations.a: Items with valid ratios are not ignored.
explanations.c: Equal ratios provide equal value per unit weight, so order does not affect the result.
explanations.d: Weight alone does not determine priority.

questions.question: Why does the Fractional Knapsack simulation always produce an optimal solution using a greedy approach?

answers.b: Because the problem satisfies the greedy choice property
answers.c: Because the knapsack size is fixed

explanations.a: The simulation does not test all combinations.
explanations.b: The greedy choice property guarantees optimality for Fractional Knapsack.
explanations.c: Fixed capacity alone does not ensure optimality.
explanations.d: Recursion is not required for this solution.

questions.question: Which observation from the simulation distinguishes Fractional Knapsack from 0/1 Knapsack?

explanations.a: Sorting can be used in multiple algorithms.
explanations.b: Dynamic programming is used in 0/1 Knapsack, not Fractional Knapsack.
explanations.c: Partial (fractional) selection is the defining characteristic.
explanations.d: Execution time alone does not define the problem type.

questions.question: What would be the effect of increasing the animation speed during Auto Play mode?

answers.c: The visualization becomes faster without affecting correctness

explanations.a: Animation speed does not affect computation results.
explanations.c: Only visualization speed changes, not algorithm logic.
